title: A Phase 1 Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Single Ascending Dose Study of KHK6640 in Japanese Patients With Alzheimer's Disease.
description_brief: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety, tolerability and pharmacokinetics of KHK6640, given as a single dose in Japanese patients with Mild to Moderate Alzheimer's Disease.
explanation_target: Reason: The trial drug KHK6640 is reported in the literature and trial registries as a humanized monoclonal antibody that selectively binds aggregated/oligomeric amyloid‑β (Aβ) — i.e., an immunotherapeutic biologic directed at Alzheimer’s pathology. This indicates a disease‑targeting biologic intended to modify pathology rather than a small molecule or symptomatic cognitive enhancer. citeturn0search1turn0search0

Act: Key extracted details from web sources — (1) KHK6640 is described as an oligomer‑specific anti‑Aβ humanized monoclonal antibody; (2) the study is a Phase 1 randomized, double‑blind, placebo‑controlled, single ascending dose study in Japanese patients with mild‑to‑moderate Alzheimer’s disease sponsored by Kyowa Hakko Kirin; (3) Phase 1/2 data and summaries report safety, pharmacokinetics, CSF target engagement and exploratory biomarker/cognition outcomes. citeturn0search1turn0search3turn0search6

Reflect: Classification check — the intervention is a biologic (monoclonal antibody) targeting Aβ oligomers (disease pathology). This fits the definition of "disease‑targeted biologic." There is no indication it is a small molecule, a purely symptomatic cognitive enhancer, or an agent aimed primarily at neuropsychiatric symptoms, so the assigned category is appropriate. citeturn0search7turn0search0

explanation_agent: Reason: The investigational product KHK6640 is described in multiple sources as a humanized monoclonal antibody that selectively binds aggregated/oligomeric forms of amyloid‑β (Aβ), i.e., an immunotherapeutic biologic directed at Aβ pathology rather than a symptomatic target. citeturn0search2turn0search1turn0search0

Act: Extracted details — (1) Drug: KHK6640, a humanized anti‑Aβ oligomer‑specific monoclonal antibody; (2) Sponsor/designer: Kyowa Hakko Kirin (licensed from Immunas/related development history); (3) Trial design: Phase 1 randomized, double‑blind, placebo‑controlled single (and related multi) ascending dose studies in AD patients; (4) Reported outcomes: safety, PK, CSF target engagement and exploratory biomarker/cognition signals. citeturn0search2turn0search3turn0search4turn0search1

Reflect: Classification check — because the molecule is an antibody whose stated mechanism is selective binding/removal (or sequestration) of aggregated/oligomeric Aβ, the correct CADRO category is A) Amyloid beta. There is no indication the primary mechanism targets tau, inflammation, synaptic receptors, metabolism, or a multi‑target strategy, so 'A) Amyloid beta' is the most specific fit. citeciteturn0search7turn0search5
